title: A New Perspective on City Logistics: Concepts, Theory, and Models for Designing and Managing Logistics as a Service
descriptions:
The proposed project, "A New Perspective on City Logistics: Concepts, Theory, and Models for Designing and Managing Logistics as a Service," aims to revolutionize city logistics planning and management by developing a innovative measurement system based on public value. This system will incorporate multi-criteria decision making, sustainability analysis, simulation, and optimization techniques to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of logistics operations in urban areas. 

The project has three main objectives: 
1. Develop public value as a measurement system using various methods such as multi-criteria decision making and sustainability analysis.
2. Design principles, models, and tools for Logistics as a Service (LaaS) infrastructure using network optimization.
3. Develop a theoretical framework and models for LaaS operating procedures by introducing logistics markets and learning-based optimization.

The expected outcomes of this project include the creation of a new theory of city logistics, efficiency gains in LaaS infrastructure, and the maximization of public value in city logistics. The implications of this research are vast, with scientific and practical implications for the transport and logistics industry, as well as social, economic, and environmental consequences. This project has the potential to significantly improve the efficiency and sustainability of city logistics, making it a valuable investment for the future of urban transportation.
